title: Birmingham Women's Team Gets New Owners with Sports Stars
summary: Birmingham City's women's football team has new owners. A company called Shelby Companies Limited bought most of the team. They are part of Knighthead Capital Management, which is led by the club's chairman Tom Wagner. The new owners have a 97% stake. The other 3% is owned by famous women like Karen Carney, who played for England and Birmingham, and Kim Clijsters, a tennis champion. The club says this will help the women's team get more attention and try to win big games. Birmingham's women's team won the FA Cup in 2012 and is now trying to move up to the top league. The team has had great players like Karen Carney. There will be no changes to the staff right away. This is an important time for the club.
